                    Transitional cell cancer of the renal pelvis and ureter is also described as localized, regional, or metastatic:
                    Localized    The cancer is found only in the kidney.       Regional    The cancer has spread to tissues around the kidney and to nearby lymph nodes and blood vessels in the pelvis.       Metastatic    The cancer has spread to other
